title: Drawing, "Wall Decoration for the Drawing Room of the Palace of Caserta", 1775
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and gouache, watercolor on off-white laid paper
signed: Signed lower right corner: Nicola Fiore
inscribed: Signed, dated and inscribed in pen and black ink at lower margin: Stanza diCompagnia del Palazzo Reale di Caserta 1775 Nicola Fiore Regio Ingre [regioIngegnere]
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee, Cambridge, MA
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Divided into three panels. In front of the dado of the central panel is a console table. Above  is a mirror with a candle bracket with four candles at either side. On top is a panel with a Chinese scene. The lateral panels are intended to have a dado and a rectangularly framed oblong Chinese representation, country scenes at left with small house in upper right of panel and figures, worship of an idol at right. Above is the lower part of the enablature.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Wall Decoration for the Drawing Room of the Palace of Caserta", 1775.
1775. Pen and black ink, brush and gouache, watercolor on off-white laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-3487.
